@Pharphain 
Let's suppose you have your very own battle music, and it's as awesome as this one, and you're like "Oh yeah, my theme rocks, fearme everyone"  then, a group of seemly weak humans comes at you and while this song is playing they kick your ass so hard that your next reincarnation will have amnesia... I think you won't like that song any more...

snippet.textDisplay: I first briefly played this game when it first came out, but didn't really get into it (and actually beat it) until the fall of 2001.  Never will I forget the awe I felt when I first fought Gades and heard this music.

snippet.textDisplay:
I've been playing this game on and off for almost 2 years and I'm maybe halfway through. The game is kind of repetitive...town, dungeon, town, dungeon, town, dungeon, Gades, town... The music is great at times and mediocre at others. The characters aren't bad, but their maturity makes them a bit boring.

One of these days I will finish the game. But so far it is way outclassed by Chrono Trigger.

Though I will admit I love the puzzles so far.
snippet.textOriginal:
I've been playing this game on and off for almost 2 years and I'm maybe halfway through. The game is kind of repetitive...town, dungeon, town, dungeon, town, dungeon, Gades, town... The music is great at times and mediocre at others. The characters aren't bad, but their maturity makes them a bit boring.

One of these days I will finish the game. But so far it is way outclassed by Chrono Trigger.

Though I will admit I love the puzzles so far.

snippet.textDisplay:
Lmao I'm glad I'm not the only one who reset the game a shitload of times cuz I didn't think you were suppose to lose to Gades. I played Lufia II before Lufia I and lucked out..made this game SO much more interesting and Lufia more interesting too since L2 was a prequel and you only knew what was in the past.

It also had me thinking the second fight where the guys go after him was the end of the game lol. I was like 'woah short game!'. So glad that gimpy douche wasn't the last sinistral..
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay:
believe me when I say that the Silvo Rapier is better than de Dual Blade, or at least it's IP-power is. Ye know, Holy Energy, 3x normal attack strength, doubled to a whopping 6x because of the Light element vs Sinistrals.

But, anyways, the song is great xD

believe me when I say that the Silvo Rapier is better than de Dual Blade, or at least it's IP-power is. Ye know, Holy Energy, 3x normal attack strength, doubled to a whopping 6x because of the Light element vs Sinistrals.

But, anyways, the song is great xD

and, overall Dekar isn't available for very long... and I didn't really find him as good as Guy, I don't know why. But for Maxim, stick with Silvo Rapier ;)
snippet.textOriginal:
Dekar should stick with the Dekar Blade, really ;)
and, overall Dekar isn't available for very long... and I didn't really find him as good as Guy, I don't know why. But for Maxim, stick with Silvo Rapier ;)

snippet.textDisplay:
Sadly, Maxim can't use Gades Blade.
But there's 2 Gades Blades in the entire game.
Guy and Dekar is the only two playable characters able to wield that sword.

snippet.textDisplay: in europe this actually was just "Lufia" and had a different front
snippet.textOriginal: in europe this actually was just "Lufia" and had a different front

snippet.textDisplay: this song is totally EPIC!
snippet.textOriginal: this song is totally EPIC!

snippet.textDisplay: imagine having two of 'em, making both Maxim AND Guy use octostrike!
snippet.textOriginal: imagine having two of 'em, making both Maxim AND Guy use octostrike!

snippet.textDisplay: Actually Gades is quite simple to beat. All you need to do is be able to buff up enough in the battle to make Guy and Selan able to withstand one of his hits. And then have Selan use the mind ring every turn (gives you access to stronger for a very reasonable amount of IP). Then you just need to hack away with Guy until he falls dead. I was ~lvl 24 when I did this I think.
snippet.textOriginal: Actually Gades is quite simple to beat. All you need to do is be able to buff up enough in the battle to make Guy and Selan able to withstand one of his hits. And then have Selan use the mind ring every turn (gives you access to stronger for a very reasonable amount of IP). Then you just need to hack away with Guy until he falls dead. I was ~lvl 24 when I did this I think.

snippet.textDisplay: If you kill him, he drops Gades Blade, one of the strongest swords in the game. It has the octostrike-ability, making Guy slash 8 times in a row when you use it. Imba.
snippet.textOriginal: If you kill him, he drops Gades Blade, one of the strongest swords in the game. It has the octostrike-ability, making Guy slash 8 times in a row when you use it. Imba.

snippet.textDisplay: He's very rewarding to beat. I've seen someone overleveled beat him, and they still got enough experience to gain a few levels.
snippet.textOriginal: He's very rewarding to beat. I've seen someone overleveled beat him, and they still got enough experience to gain a few levels.
